text: What symptoms have you experienced in the last week?
What is your date of birth?
Where do you live?
How many people including the participant live in household?
How many bedrooms are in your home?
Which shelter do you consider to be your primary residence?
What is your current address?
How long have you been homeless?
How long have you been coming to this shelter?
How many nights in a row have you stayed at this shelter as of today?
What is your bed assignment?
Have you been at any of the following other shelters or community centers in the past 7 days?

choices.text: Main Branch of Seattle Public Library

text: What is your current address?
What is your current address?

These questions are about being **in contact** with people who seemed to have a cold. **In contact** means being within 6 feet of them for at least 2 minutes. For reference, 6 feet is about the distance between you and someone sitting 2 rows ahead of you on the bus.
In the past week, have you (the participant) been **in contact** with a person who seemed to have a cold?
Were they coughing or sneezing?
In the past week, have you been **in contact** with any children under 5 years of age for over an hour?
Are you a staff member at Hutch Kids?
Are there any children under 18 in your household?
Do any children in your household attend a school, childcare setting, or play group with at least 3 other children for 3 or more hours per week?
Are any children in your household enrolled at Hutch Kids?
Do you smoke tobacco, marijuana, or vape?
Does anyone in your household smoke tobacco, marijuana, or vape?
Do you ever drink alcohol?
How often do you drink a serving of alcohol? (4 oz of liquor or 1 can of beer = 1 serving)
Do you use any recreational drugs besides marijuana?
What drugs do you use?
Do you inject any of these drugs?
Do you drink alcohol?
On average, how many alcoholic drinks do you consume per week? (1 drink = 1 beer, 1 glass of wine, or 1.5 fl oz/1 shot of hard alcohol)
Where have you traveled in the last month?
What state(s) or countries have you traveled to in the past month?
Was this travel in the past 7 days?
Where have you or anyone in your household traveled in the last month?
What state(s) or countries have you or anyone in your household traveled to in the past month?
Are you a Fred Hutch employee?
Over the past 7 days and when you are awake, where have you spent the majority of your time?
What is your primary occupation?
Where do you work?
How many hours do you work each day, on average?
What type of school do you attend?
What is the name of your school?
If you are a college student, what is/are your majors?
If you are a UW student, which buildings do you spend the most time in on campus (in addition to your residence)?
During a normal day, how many people are you **in contact** with?
Did you get a flu shot in the last year?
What was the date of your flu shot?
Where did you receive your flu shot?
How many days have you been sick?
Is your cold stopping you from doing things you would usually do?
In the past week, has your cold kept you from:

choices.text: Performing well on an exam or school assignment

text: Have you seen a healthcare provider for your cold this week?
Did you take prescription medicine such as antibiotics or antivirals for this current cold?
Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have one of the following medical conditions?
What was your assigned sex at birth?
What was your assigned sex at birth?
Are you currently pregnant?
How would you describe your race?

text: Are you Hispanic or Latino?

text: How did you hear about the Seattle Flu Study?
Where have you traveled in the past 14 days? (This includes airports where you may have had a layover, and your home country.)

What US states have you traveled to in the past 14 days?
What countries have you traveled to in the past 14 days?

How did you arrive in Seattle?

What day did you arrive in Seattle by airplane?
What day did you arrive in Seattle by cruise?
Select the cruise line for your arrival to Seattle.
What is your country of residence?
In your country of residence, where do you live?
Do you plan to stay in Seattle overnight (or have you already stayed in Seattle overnight?)
What is the address in Seattle where you stayed last night (or plan to stay tonight, if different)?
Where will you be staying in the next week?
